job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN), Nursing Home in Middletown, OH
pros:
Coworkers are friendly

cons: Walking house to house in the elements

review_title: If you want to make low pay and work for manager younger than you who does’t have your back, then choose Otterbein
pros: Made some great friendships with a few nurses and STNA’s.
cons: Policies change to benefit management whenever they don’t like someone. Some rules don’t apply to all. Nurses do not get paid based on experience. Nurses also didn’t receive a cost of living raise when the STNA’s did. Nurses don’t get breaks and can’t leave the facility, but make sure you give your STNA a break or you’re “disconnected!” There is suppose to be meals for all shift employees, but 3rd shift is forgotten. Being mandated to work the next shift when someone calls off happens far too often. Meetings are scheduled at inconvenient times. Nurses don’t have enough time to complete everything in a shift on a good day. Throw in an admission and a fall, there’s no hope, no help, and STNA’s just want to report you for not showing up if they call you 30 seconds ago to look at someone’s poop “because they are doctors” when you have 25 people to take care of! You can only advance if you threaten to quit.

review_title: Thoroughly Check Out Where You Are Leaving Your Loved Ones
pros: They serve excellent food to all of the residents. There seemed to be a lot of extra activities and trips for the residents to participate in. They typically do a large Christmas program that includes the residents participation.
cons: They are not flexible with an employees hours at all. I worked Monday through Friday and was not permitted at all to take a day off, even with notice. I could not accumulate sick time or vacation time, nor could I take a day off without pay. If I did take a day off, which I was forced to because my son was ill, I even had a doctor's note, I was wrote up for each day I was off and accumulated points. Whether I was ill or not, I ALWAYS went to work. That is how I was brought up.

pros: It is a job, residents are the only joy in this job
cons: very low pay except management positions, very little PTO unless you are an executive, executives are not in touch with reality, all Otterbein ever does is build new locations or upgrade existing locations and they are not concerned about the employees that work for them, employees are treated like a number and we work short staffed all the time and get no appreciation, we are always asked to do more with less. Management should appreciate the staff more and the staff would be more willing to take care of the residents. Stop building new locations and focusing on new revenue and concentrate on your core business by taking care of your staff and giving your residents consistent caregivers

pros: Food allowance to full time employees
cons: If you like stress and working under staffed daily this job is for you! Not to mention management is full of crap! A bunch of liars and manipulators. And this is supposed to be a faith based company! HA HA! Residents are treated like garbage and are constantly unhappy because they cant get the care they pay for. You will be mandated after working all day, some times multiple times a week. Funny thing is there is no mandation policy and it's illegal for them to force people to work, and they will say or threaten anything to get you to stay, they do it to who they think they can. This my friends is slavery. The supervisors and management is too lazy to come in and work or let alone schedule people to work so they punish those who show up to work with forced mandation. Also, they have new people training other new people. Safe right? Supplies is always limited, sometimes they dont even have wash clothes to change people with. There is always chaos and the scheduler hounds you on every day off you have to come in and work. If you like working in a toxic work environment that has no respect for its employees or residents this ones for you!

review_title: Too much for too little pay
pros: I love the concept, it's more like a home rather than your typical depressing nursing home. The aides seem to really care about the residents, that really seems to be the only thing keeping them there.
cons: Poor training, aides are responsible for the cleaning, cooking, dishes, laundry, and patient care. They mandate you to stay if your relief does not come in (happens a lot). 8 hours shifts turn into 16 hrs. You can not plan a life outside of work when you have no idea IF you are going to work 8 or 16. It's also unsafe as employees are exhausted and tired.

review_title: My experience is okay here but definitely irritating that management doesn't listen to the needs of the aides.
pros: It is a very relaxed environment, and everyone is very friendly. The setting isn't so much of 'nursing home' but feels like it is their actual home so you definitely get to know your elders very well.
cons: Since it is a laid back environment employees get away with a lot of things that they shouldn't get away with. Also the pay is by experience, which sucks that it doesn't matter if you work harder than someone else. Again, management doesn't listen very well to the needs of the aides.

pros: Managers give you space and trust in your abilities. Consistent work schedule. Free lunch everyday. Fellow employees are pretty nice for the most part. Residents are great and a pleasure to be around. Plenty of overtime.
cons: Management expects way too much on a daily basis. Have to stay late many days to get everything done on the days schedule. Pay is not very good for the amount of work that is expected. Lots of employee turnover. No room to advance.

pros: I loved the job responsibilities. There was a set flow so I always knew what was to be expected once I got within the swing of things. There was 2 weeks of training before I was left alone, which was nice, and they even wanted to train me longer but I declined.
cons: There were always schedules that were not filled so you had to stay after your shift ended. Sometimes they wanted me to work doubles when I had school the next day, but would always find someone to cover me so I could go home eventually.

pros:
Fantastic management learning experience 
Large company with opportunities to grow
Lots of creative freedom as a chef
cons:
Upper management can be secretive and condisending at times
Long hours and long days as a manager

pros: The atmosphere is nice and there are very nice caring coworkers.  The residents that you take care of are appreciative of your help. The company also gives you a free lunch or reimbursement if you work a late shift.  They often do employee appreciation cookouts.
cons: The pay is on the low end of the scale and the positions are understaffed  making it very stressful due to the number of residents you are expected to care for.

pros: The home style atmosphere is nice.
cons: The administration lacks a basic knowledge of people skills and seems to have no healthcare knowledge.  They don't pay holiday but expect that you work it and have you take out of your PTO.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Batavia, OH
pros: Relaxed, home-like environment, residents have their private rooms, and can have meals with their families, etc.
cons: Nurse-resident ratio is very high. It is not one nurse per house. Nurses keep going back and forth between houses with little to no time left to fully assess their patients. Multiple admissions at a time happen frequently. Low pay, high turnover, no holiday pay.

review_title: Seems like a great place to work
job_title: Elder Assistant (STNA) in New Albany, OH
pros: Household mentality instead of being like a facility.  Ratio during the day is 2:10, on third shift the ratio is 1:10.  You schedule yourself through an app.  You can utilize activpay if you want.
cons: The 3rd shift cannot leave during lunch break.

pros: Not a bad job and a good way to get your STNA paid for.
cons: Terrible management. They don’t listen to concerns. They find any reason to say something to you. No regard for the elders actual care. Lots of mandating. You’re doing STNA work as well as cooking and cleaning and if you get busy and fall behind Management gets very rude.

review_title: Use to be good now I hate it
pros: Coworkers. Low patient to staff ratio.
cons: Lots of mandating and the pay is incredibly low. Management is a joke. They only care If there is a body working the floor. I don't feel appreciated there. No room to grow also.

pros: Otterbein feels like home to me.  I have worked in various aspects of nursing and I have never really felt like I belonged.  The staff are great and really care about the elders and each other. There is a great spirit within the walls of Otterbein Lebanon
cons: The facility is large, intimidating at first but easy to learn

pros: Free meals, residents and their families
cons: Lazy, unprofessional co-workers causing too much drama and full of lies, rumors and gossips; poor management

pros: Really nice place to work, laid back,
cons: The place is really nice it's some of employees not so nice.

pros: The pay is really good. You will create a bond between you and the residents. The residents care for you as if you are their own.
cons: There is nothing but drama. Employees act as if they are in high school. people fuel them self's off of the negative energy.
